profile.name: Xiangling Wu
profile.title: Environmental Science & Engineering | Ph.D. Candidate
profile.intro: Focusing on the construction of coupled systems of Anaerobic Ammonium Oxidation (Anammox) and Microbial Fuel Cells (MFC), exploring the succession laws of functional microbial communities and stability control strategies in complex biochemical environments.

education.major: Joint Ph.D. in Environmental Engineering | QS Rank 8

Water Supply & Drainage Science and Engineering | Bachelor (Recommended for Admission)
Finance | Bachelor (Double Degree)

intro: Development of low-carbon processes for urban sewage treatment towards dual-carbon goals, regulation of microbial metabolic mechanisms, and system engineering applications.

Dedicated to the synergistic resource utilization path of kitchen waste and sewage treatment, converting biochemical reaction mechanisms into industrial Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) to achieve long-term stable operation and low-carbon delivery of engineering projects.
papers: Zhang K*, Wu X (Co-first), et al. Anaerobic oxidation of methane (AOM) driven by multiple electron acceptors... Chemical Engineering Journal (IF 13.3).
Zhang K*, Wu X (Co-first), et al. The role and related microbial processes of Mn-dependent anaerobic methane oxidation... Journal of Environmental Management (IF 8).
Zhang K*, Wu X, et al. CH4 control and associated microbial process from constructed wetland... Journal of Environmental Management (IF 8).
patents: A CW-MFC device and method for reducing methane and ammonia nitrogen pollution (ZL 2020 1 1011944.0)
A U-shaped device and operation method for microbial fuel cell coupled constructed wetland (ZL 2019 1 1263024.5)
Wastewater denitrification treatment system and its treatment method (ZL 2023 1 1635783.6)

projects.name: Innovation & Entrepreneurship Competition | Carbon Chain Synergy & Value Transformation Platform
details: Problem Definition: Targeting the fragmentation of accounting standards and mismatch of benefits, proposing a digital collaborative solution.
Cross-boundary Coordination: Led a cross-disciplinary team from Tsinghua and Peking University to develop an AI carbon platform (98% accuracy), solving the pain point of manual accounting efficiency.
Achievements: Won National Third Prize in Graduate "Dual Carbon" Competition, First Prize at Tsinghua, and Winner of Kunshan Cup.

projects.name: Shenzhen Science and Technology Innovation Commission Sustainable Development Special Project | R&D and Application of Kitchen Waste Hydrolysate PD/A Denitrification Process
details: Technical R&D: Led the R&D of a PD/A coupling system based on kitchen waste, overcoming the industry-level bottleneck of microbial community instability.
Commercialization: In-situ conversion completely replaced external carbon sources, reducing costs by 30%~50%, and implementing a 50 mÂ³/d demonstration project.

projects.name: National Key R&D Program Youth Project | Low-carbon Preparation of Bio-based Plastics from Brewing Waste
details: Product R&D: Developed new bio-based materials, extending the shelf life of fruits and vegetables by more than 1 time and reducing raw material costs by 40%.

campus.role: Counselor & Psychology Club President | Mar 2023 - Sep 2025

Pioneered a closed-loop management system, coordinated 40+ performances, and achieved the first campus championship.
Awarded Tsinghua "Outstanding Class" (Top 5%), with 100% peer review excellence rate for three consecutive years.

honors: National Scholarship, Provincial Outstanding Graduate, Outstanding Student Cadre, Tsinghua Comprehensive Scholarship, Outstanding Social Work Scholarship, Sichuan Agricultural University Annual Outstanding Graduate Student Model, Master's Academic Scholarship, Outstanding Academic Achievement, Outstanding Literary and Artistic Backbone, etc.
